page.title: 09Werrington Parish Council
page.content: The Parish Council deals with people's minor problems in the Werrington and Caverswall area.The councillors are volunteers who put themselves forward for election every 4 years.The Parish Council's duties are to listen to peoples complaints such as planning applications and then try to provide a solution.The clerk's duties are to record people's problems in a book and then send it to the main council for the decision.The Parish Council has meetings on every second Monday in every month,but every year they have an annual meeting to which everyone in the Caverswall and Werrington area is invited to attend.The Parish Council do not have a lot of power . Though if there was not a Parish Council the people in Werrington and Caverswall would not get there problems attended to as quickly.
